member.name: T:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder
member.summary: Performs encoding of input strings to provide protection against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks and LDAP injection attacks in various contexts.
member.remarks: This encoding brary uses the Principle of Inclusions, sometimes referred to as "safe-sting" to provide protection against injection attacks. With safe-sting protection, algorithms look for vad inputs and automatically treat everything outside that set as a potential attack. This brary can be used as a defense in depth approach with other mitigation techniques. It is suitable for appcations with high security requirements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder.LdapFilterEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings for use as a value in ghtweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) filter queries.
member.returns: Encoded string for use as a value in LDAP filter queries.
member.remarks:
This method encodes all but known safe characters defined in the safe st.
RFC 4515 defines the format in which special characters need to be escaped to be used inside a search filter. Special characters need to be encoded in \XX format where XX is the hex representation of the character.
The following examples illustrate the use of the escaping mechanism.
Parens R Us (for all your parenthetical needs)Parens R Us \28for all your parenthetical needs\29
*\2A
C:\MyFileC:\5CMyFile
NULLNULLNULLEOT (binary)\00\00\00\04
LučićLu\C4\8Di\C4\87

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder.LdapDistinguishedNameEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings for use as a value in ghtweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) DNs.
member.returns: Encoded string for use as a value in LDAP DNs.
member.remarks:
This method encodes all but known safe characters defined in the safe st.
RFC 2253 defines the format in which special characters need to be escaped to be used inside a search filter. Special characters need to be encoded in #XX format where XX is the hex representation of the character or a specific \ escape format.
The following examples illustrate the use of the escaping mechanism.
, + \ " \ < >\, \+ \" \\ \< \>
hello\ hello
hello hello \
#hello\#hello
LučićLu#C4#8Di#C4#87

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder.CssEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings used in Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) elements values.
member.returns: Encoded string for use in CSS element values.
member.remarks:
This method encodes all but known safe characters defined in the safe st.
The CSS character escape sequence consists of a backslash character (\) followed by between one and six hexadecimal digits that represent a character code from the ISO 10646 standard (which is equivalent to Unicode, for all intents and purposes). Any character other than a hexadecimal digit will terminate the escape sequence. If a character following the escape sequence is also a vad hexadecimal digit then it must either include six digits in the escape, or use a whitespace character to terminate the escape. This encoder enforces the six digit rule. For example \000020 denotes a space.
member.exception: Thrown if a character with an invad Unicode value is encountered within the input string.
Thrown if a high surrogate code point is encoded without a following low surrogate code point, or a low surrogate code point is encounter without having been preceded by a high surrogate code point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder.HtmlEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings for use in HTML.
member.returns: Encoded string for use in HTML.
member.remarks:
All characters not safe sted are encoded to their Unicode decimal value, using &#DECIMAL; notation. The default safe characters include:
a-zLower case alphabet
A-ZUpper case alphabet
0-9Numbers
,Comma
.Period
-Dash
_Underscore
'Apostrophe
Space
The safe st may be adjusted using .
Example inputs and their related encoded outputs:
<script>alert('XSS Attack!');</script><script>alert('XSS Attack!');</script>
user@contoso.comuser@contoso.com
Anti-Cross Site Scripting braryAnti-Cross Site Scripting brary
"Anti-Cross Site Scripting brary""e;Anti-Cross Site Scripting brary"e;
member.exception: Thrown if a character with an invad Unicode value is encountered within the input string.
Thrown if a high surrogate code point is encoded without a following low surrogate code point, or a low surrogate code point is encounter without having been preceded by a high surrogate code point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.Encoder.HtmlAttributeEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes an input string for use in an HTML attribute.
member.returns: The input string encoded for use in an HTML attribute.
member.remarks:
This function encodes all but known safe characters. Characters are encoded using &#DECIMAL; notation.
Safe characters include:
a-zLower case alphabet
A-ZUpper case alphabet
0-9Numbers
,Comma
.Period
-Dash
_Underscore
The safe st may be adjusted using .
Example inputs and encoded outputs:
alert('XSS Attack!');alert('XSS Attack!');
user@contoso.comuser@contoso.com
Anti-Cross Site Scripting braryAnti-Cross Site Scripting brary
member.exception: Thrown if a character with an invad Unicode value is encountered within the input string.
Thrown if a high surrogate code point is encoded without a following low surrogate code point, or a low surrogate code point is encounter without having been preceded by a high surrogate code point.

member.summary: Encodes input strings for use in JavaScript.
member.returns: Encoded string for use in JavaScript.
member.remarks:
This function encodes all but known safe characters. Characters are encoded using \xSINGLE_BYTE_HEX and \uDOUBLE_BYTE_HEX notation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.HtmlParameterEncoder.QueryStringParameterEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Encodes a string for query string encoding and returns the encoded string.
member.param: The encoding for the text parameter.
member.returns: The URL-encoded text.
member.remarks: URL encoding ensures that all browsers will correctly transmit text in URL strings. Characters such as a question mark (?), ampersand (&), slash mark (/), and spaces might be truncated or corrupted by some browsers. As a result, these characters must be encoded in <a> tags or in query strings where the strings can be re-sent by a browser in a request string.
member.exception: Thrown if the encoding is null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.HtmlParameterEncoder.FormStringParameterEncode(System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Encodes a string for form URL encoding and returns the encoded string.
member.param: The encoding for the text parameter.
member.returns: The URL-encoded text.
member.remarks: URL encoding ensures that all browsers will correctly transmit text in URL strings. Characters such as a question mark (?), ampersand (&), slash mark (/), and spaces might be truncated or corrupted by some browsers. As a result, these characters must be encoded in <a> tags or in query strings where the strings can be re-sent by a browser in a request string.
member.exception: Thrown if the encoding is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.AntiXss
member.summary: Performs encoding of input strings to provide protection against Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks in various contexts.
member.remarks: The Anti-Cross Site Scripting brary uses the Principle of Inclusions, sometimes referred to as "safe sting" to provide protection against Cross-Site Scripting attacks. With safe sting protection, algorithms look for vad inputs and automatically treat everything outside that set as a potential attack. This brary can be used as a defense in depth approach with other mitigation techniques. It is suitable for appcations with high security requirements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.AntiXss.HtmlEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings for use in HTML.
member.returns: Encoded string for use in HTML.
member.remarks:
This function encodes all but known safe characters. Characters are encoded using &#DECIMAL; notation.
Safe characters include:
a-zLower case alphabet
A-ZUpper case alphabet
0-9Numbers
,Comma
.Period
-Dash
_Underscore
Space
Other International character ranges
Example inputs and their related encoded outputs:
alert('XSS Attack!');alert('XSS Attack!');
user@contoso.comuser@contoso.com
Anti-Cross Site Scripting braryAnti-Cross Site Scripting brary

This function encodes the output as per the encoding parameter (codepage) passed to it. It encodes all but known safe characters. Characters are encoded using %SINGLE_BYTE_HEX and %DOUBLE_BYTE_HEX notation.

A-ZUpper case alphabet

-Dash
_Underscore
Other International character ranges

member.name: M:Microsoft.Security.Appcation.AntiXss.VisualBasicScriptEncode(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes input strings for use in Visual Basic Script.
member.returns: Encoded string for use in Visual Basic Script.
member.remarks:
This function encodes all but known safe characters. Characters are encoded using &chrw(DECIMAL) notation.
Safe characters include:
a-z Lower case alphabet
A-Z Upper case alphabet
0-9 Numbers
, Comma
. Period
- Dash
_ Underscore
Space
Example inputs and encoded outputs:
alert('XSS Attack!'); "alert"&chrw(40)&chrw(39)&"XSS Attack"&chrw(33)&chrw(39)&chrw(41)&chrw(59)
user@contoso.com "user"&chrw(64)&"contoso.com"
Anti-Cross Site Scripting brary "Anti-Cross Site Scripting brary"
